item.latestTitle: Alaska Native Claims Settlement Improvement Act of 2017

item.title: A bill to provide for certain conveyances of surface estate under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act, and for other purposes.
ANCSA Kaktovik and Canyon Village Land Conveyance Settlement Act of 2017
ANCSA Kaktovik and Canyon Village Land Conveyance Settlement Act of 2017

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced

bill.title: ANCSA Kaktovik and Canyon Village Land Conveyance Settlement Act of 2017

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.name: Introduced in Senate
item.text:
ANCSA Kaktovik and Canyon Village Land Conveyance Settlement Act of 2017

This bill requires the Department of the Interior to convey: (1) specified surface estate to the Kaktovik Inupiat Corporation, an Alaska Native village corporation, in accordance with an agreement effective January 22, 1993; and (2) specified subsurface estate to the Arctic Slope Regional Corporation, the Alaska Native regional corporation for the village of Kaktovik, pursuant to an agreement dated August 9, 1983.

Interior also must convey: (1) up to 6,400 acres of surface estate to Kian Tr'ee Corporation, a village corporation, for the village of Canyon Village; and (2) equal acreage of subsurface estate to Doyon Limited, the regional corporation for Canyon Village.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
